p: The saponin- and steroid-rich fractions of butanolic extract and the hydroalcoholic total extract were investigated for their pharmacologic action in normal and diabetic rats. It was found that none of the fractions were able to cause hypoglycemia in normal groups, but both applied extracts were effective in lowering blood glucose in diabetic animals [ 212]. It was postulated that C. sativus seed extracts have biguanides-like or euglycemic effects in diabetic condition [ 212].
